alert.note: Alert for Northern La Porte (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued June 07 at 4:50AM EDT until June 08 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...High wave action, strong currents, and dangerous swimming conditions expected. * WHERE...In Indiana, Northern La Porte county. In Michigan, Northern Berrien and Southern Berrien counties. * WHEN...From this afternoon through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Strong currents can pull swimmers into deeper water. Also, water temperatures are still in the 50s and thus present a danger to swimmers. Cold water makes it hard to swim, and can lead to drowning from stiff muscles and the shock of sudden immersion. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Wave heights will build to 3 to 5 feet by late evening with long wave periods that will be conducive to dangerous currents, especially on the north side of piers.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions. Do not venture out on piers.
